Crimes.Dispute_Type: Judicial conduct investigation vs. solicitor-client privilege

Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Not yet conducted; claims based on anticipated investigation
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Application for judicial review dismissed as premature
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate jurisdictional overreach or breach of rights

Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged breach of solicitor-client privilege and lack of jurisdiction over past legal conduct
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Committee must respect procedural fairness, but no determination made yet
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: None formally considered; allegations not tested
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Inquiry exceeds jurisdiction and violates privilege
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Not applicable – respondent is administrative body
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Stay or halt of Inquiry Committee investigation
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Investigation into pre-judicial conduct, privilege concerns
Crimes.Pending_Relief_or_Application: Judicial review application dismissed without prejudice
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Judges Act and principles of procedural fairness

Crimes.Crime_Name: Possession of Cocaine for Purpose of Trafficking
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Judicial conduct investigation vs. criminal allegations
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Does the CJC have jurisdiction to investigate a judge’s alleged past drug-related conduct?
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Based on conflicting witness statements; not adjudicated
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to show lack of jurisdiction or unfairness
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Conflicting witness accounts affect credibility assessment
Crimes.Legal_Rule: CJC may investigate conduct affecting judicial integrity, even if pre-appointment
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Lack of jurisdiction over pre-judicial conduct, procedural unfairness
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Not decided – matter sent back to administrative process
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: To be determined by Inquiry Committee in due course
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Witness testimony alleging purchase of cocaine
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Investigation beyond statutory mandate and constitutionally improper
Crimes.Court_Result: Application dismissed, process allowed to proceed
Crimes.Defendant_Response: CJC asserts jurisdiction under statutory mandate
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Halt to investigation via judicial review
Crimes.Resolution_Mechanism: Internal CJC inquiry followed by potential public hearing
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Alleged possession of cocaine prior to judicial appointment
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Judges Act and administrative law principles
